persons.name: Aethyta
persons.description: A tough, no-nonsense bartender on Illium.

3.description: Formerly a tough, no-nonsense bartender on Illium, Aethyta now tends bar at a cafe on the Citadel. She admits to Shepard that she is Liara's father and has been keeping an eye on her girl (which Liara - the Shadow Broker - already knows).

persons.name: Aresh Aghdashloo
persons.description: One of the children Cerberus experimented on while they were experimenting on Jack, Aresh responded to the torments in a very different way and wants to reopen the facility on Pragia, to somehow find some reason to justify what was done to them.
sideEffects: If Aresh is spared, a news report in Game 3 reports that he died saving a shuttle of children evacuating the colony of Elysium.

persons.name: Anaya
persons.description: Anaya is investigating the recent murder of Dakni Kur, Pitne For's business partner. She detains the justicar, Samara - who is also investigating the murder - under orders from her superiors, but she is worried Samara may kill her for obstructing the justicar's business.

persons.name: Anto Korragan
persons.description: Aria T'Loak's trusted bodyguard and second-in-command, Anto is also making a little extra on the side. If Shepard confronts him about this after discovering his duplicity in [megametracker://mission?id=A2.O.PackagesForIsh], Anto cleans up (and kills Ish).

3.description: Aria T'Loak's trusted bodyguard and second-in-command, Anto defended Afterlife during the Cerberus takeover. He was killed by an adjutant while trying to help Aria retake Afterlife (from the comic *Mass Effect: Invasion*).

persons.name: David Archer
persons.description: The autistic brother of Cerberus scientist [Gavin Archer|megametracker://person?id=O2.ArcherG], David has a natural affinity to mathematics, computers, and geth, which unfortunately Gavin exploits to further his research for Cerberus on Project Overlord.

3.description:
The autistic brother of Cerberus scientist [Gavin Archer|megametracker://person?id=O2.ArcherG], David has a natural affinity to mathematics, computers, and geth, which unfortunately Gavin exploited in Game 2 to further his research for Cerberus on Project Overlord. 

If Shepard saves David in Game 2, he reappears in [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GrissomAcademy] and provides Shepard with the code to a room with special weapons.

persons.name: Gavin Archer
persons.description: Chief scientist of Project Overlord (DLC) on Aite, Dr. Archer is the only surviving member of the research team after a rogue VI takes over the facility. Dr. Archer needs Shepard's help to prevent the AI from escaping off-world and infecting other systems.

3.description:
Formerly chief scientist of Project Overlord for the Illusive Man, Dr. Archer took advantage of his autistic brother [megametracker://person?id=O2.ArcherD] to further his research. 

Gavin's current life depends greatly on Shepard's actions. If David dies in Game 3 (or Shepard claims he did), Gavin will kill himself.

persons.name: Blasto
persons.description: Blasto is the James Bond of the Mass Effect universe. There are advertisments for various Blasto movies throughout Games 2 and 3. Shepard can meet him in person during an excursion with Javik in [megametracker://mission?id=DLC3.Citadel].

persons.name: Careena
persons.description: A concierge on Illium, Careena greets Shepard on arrival and is available for questions about Nos Astra in the hanger at any time.

persons.name: Cathka
persons.description: Charged with repairing the gunship, Cathka is an important target when recruiting Archangel.

persons.name: Charr
persons.description: The krogan boyfriend of the asari merchant, [megametracker://person?id=O2.Ereba], Charr is devastated by their breakup and will do whatever it takes to win her back.
sideEffects: If Shepard convinces Ereba and Charr to stay together, they later can be seen on Tuchanka.
Regardless of the outcome of their romance, Shepard finds a message from (deceased) Charr to Ereba in Game 3.
persons.x-comment-y: TODO: mission 3 link to charr's death message. Get voice actor

persons.name: Daniel Abrams
persons.description: An idealistic (naive) volunteer at [Mordin's|megametracker://person?id=S2.Mordin] Medical Clinic on Omega, Dr. Abrams is captured by batarians while trying to bring vaccines to sick batarians behind vorcha lines. The batarians, deeply suspicious of humans, accuse him of trying to poison the sick.

persons.name: Kar'Danna vas Rayya
persons.description: Captain of [Tali's|megametracker://person?id=S1.Tali] birth ship, the Rayya, Kar'Danna is the one to greet Shepard and Tali as they board for her trial.
sideEffects: In Game 3, if the quarian fleet is destroyed, Danna can be heard in a distress call from the Rayya as it plummets to Rannoch.

persons.name: Urdnot Darg
persons.description: A scout taken captive by the Weyrloc, Darg initially refuses to leave, believing that he can help cure the genophage.

persons.name: Delan
persons.description: Delan escaped capture during the initial attack by the Collectors by hiding in a shed.

persons.name: Deleia Sanassi
persons.description: The shopkeeper/customer service at Citadel Souvenirs in Zakera Ward, Deleia will offer Shepard a discount in exchange for an endorsement (or alternatively, is Shepard accuses her of discriminating against the poor, which is much more amusing).

persons.name: Elan'Shiya
persons.description: Elan is caring for [megametracker://person?id=O2.Veetor] during Tali's trial.
sideEffects: If Veetor speaks up for Tali in the trial, afterwards Elan suggests that maybe he just needed a pretty girl as motivation, and he agrees, but is looking at Elan.

persons.name: Elnora
persons.description: On first encounter, Elnora briefly pretends to be a junior member of the Eclipse gang, disillusioned but too afraid to escape. After she abandons the facade and attacks Shepard, she either escapes or dies. Later, an audio log is discovered recording Elnora gleefully narrating her intitation kill the night before, a volus - presumably Dakni Kur, [Pitne For's|megametracker://person?id=O2.PitneFor] murdered partner.

persons.name: Ereba
persons.description: A merchant at the Blue Rose of Illium, Ereba is having some boyfriend troubles. Her smitted krogan boyfriend, [megametracker://person?id=O2.Charr] is desperately trying to win her back (with poetry), but she doubts his reasons.
sideEffects: If Shepard convinces Ereba and Charr to stay together, they later can be seen on Tuchanka.
Regardless of the outcome of their romance, Shepard finds a message from (deceased) Charr to Ereba in Game 3.
persons.x-comment-y: TODO: mission 3 link to charr's death message. Get voice actor

persons.name: Erinya
persons.description: After losing her bondmate and two daughters to alien attacks, Erinya holds a deep hatred for non-Asari.

persons.name: Esheel
persons.description: If Shepard fails to save the Destiny Ascension, she will replace the deceased [megametracker://person?id=O1.Valern].

persons.name: Feron
persons.description: After helping [Liara|megametracker://person?id=S1.Liara] recover Shepard's body, he is taken captive by the [Shadow Broker|megametracker://person?id=E2.ShadowBroker] while helping [Liara|megametracker://person?id=S1.Liara] escape. If Shepard accompanies Liara in Lair of the Shadow Broker (DLC), Feron is rescued and remains on the ship to recover and assist her in processing their new resources. Without Shepard's help, he dies when she takes on the Shadow Broker alone.

persons.name: Forvan
persons.description: Harboring a grudge against humans, Forvan has acquired a reputation for poisoning humans at the lower Afterlife bar on Omega.

persons.name: Fortack
persons.description: Having killed his predecessor to obtain his role, Fortack is tasked with researching technology to improve krogan life, although he really only enjoys crafting weapons and explosives. He run's Fortack's Database, one of the two shops in the Urdnot camp on Tuchanka.

persons.name: Garka
persons.description: Garka works for Aria T'Loak on Omega. He is always found next to her private booth.

persons.name: Preitor Gavorn
persons.description: Hired by [megametracker://person?id=P2.Aria] to keep vorcha out of Afterlife, Gavorn views them as a pestilence on Omega and congratulates Shepard for killing them.

persons.name: Grizz
persons.description: Aria's bodyguard.

persons.name: Presidium Groundskeeper
persons.description: He hangs out at the Dark Star and can provide information about the Presidium lakes.

persons.name: Haron
persons.description: Haron works at the security checkpoint at Zakara Ward. When Shepard first arrives on the Citadel, he reports that the Commander is listed as dead in Citadel records.

persons.name: Harrot
persons.description: Harrot runs a shop on Omega.

3.description: Harrot ran a shop on Omega. He can be found in Aria's bunker when helping Aria retake the station, where he asks for Shepard's help in regaining Aria's favor by locating her favorite couch after General Petrovsky threw it out of Afterlife.

persons.name: Hermia
persons.description: The Serrice Technologies merchant on Illium, Hermia can be Charmed or Intimidated into giving Shepard a discount. She is also being investigated for smuggling by [megametracker://person?id=O1.Gianna] (provided this is a Game 1 import and Gianna survived).

persons.name: Info Drone "Glyph"
persons.description: Info Drone is the Shadow Broker's assistant. Liara renames it Glyph in Game 3. It plays a major role in the Citadel DLC events.

persons.name: Ish
persons.description: Loitering in Omega outside the slums, Ish asks Shepard to pick up some packages for him. Once acquired, the packages reveal that Ish is collecting blackmail on [megametracker://person?id=O2.Anto].
sideEffects: If Miranda or Jacob are on the squad when speaking to Ish, they will remark on a past encounter from the mobile game *Mass Effect: Galaxy*.

persons.name: Irissa
persons.description: If Shepard fails to save the Destiny Ascension, she will replace the deceased [megametracker://person?id=O1.Tevos].

persons.name: Jentha
persons.description: Jentha doubts her senior Tarak's leadership, but is fiercely loyal to the Blue Suns.

persons.name: Kal'Reegar
persons.description: Part of the squad assigned to protect [megametracker://person?id=S1.Tali] on Haestrom, Kal'Reegar ends up the last survivor, wounded but stubbornly insisting on joining in the final fight. If he does not die, he comes forward as a vocal defendent of Tali in her later treason trial.

persons.name: Kargesh
persons.description: Kargesh can be found in Zakera Ward arguing with his companion, [masseffectracker://person?id=O2.Rukar], over whether there are fish in the Presidium lakes. He thinks it would be very decadent to eat something so unobtainable.

persons.name: Amanda Kenson
persons.description: Investigating rumors of Reaper technology in a Batarian system, Kenson is imprisoned by the Batarians as a terrorist on Aratoht. [Hackett|megametracker://person?id=P1.Hackett] sends Shepard to rescue her, but not only did her team find a Reaper artifact ("Object Rho"), Indoctrination has occurred.

persons.name: Keiji Okuda
persons.description: A former partner and lover of Kasumi Goto, Keiji was a skilled thief and a former member of the Alliance Intelligence Agency. He was killed by [megametracker://person?id=E2.Hock] for his graybox, containing sensitive information.
sideEffects: If Shepard does not persuade Kasumi to destroy the graybox and also opts for synthesis at the end of Game 3, Keiji is reunited with Kasumi in the final cutscenes.

persons.name: Elias Kelham
persons.description: A small-time criminal who rose to prominence after Saren attacked the Citadel and killed mnay of the other crime bosses, Elias is the one who hired [megametracker://person?id=O2.Kolyat] as an assassin. Elias is uncooperative in revealing who the target was, but eventually reveals it was Joram Talid.

persons.name: Kenn
persons.description: Kenn runs a salvage shop on Omega. He was robbed while on Pilgrimage on Omega and is trying to earn enough money to go home, but is undercut by the other merchants and has failed to do so.

persons.name: Kian Louros
persons.description: The shopkeeper/customer service at Sirta Foundation in Zakera Ward, Kian will offer Shepard a discount in exchange for an endorsement.

persons.name: Kolyat Krios
persons.description: The only child of [megametracker://person?id=S2.Thane], Kolyat was abandoned as a boy, after Thane's wife was murdered and Thane left to hunt down her killers.

persons.name: Kor Tun
persons.description: Kor Tun ran into a young quarian in Zakera Ward and immediately accused her, with very little cause, of stealing his credit chit. He is over-sensitive and deeply prejudiced.

persons.name: Lanteia
persons.description: Miranda's contact at the bar on Illium, Lanteia will provide Miranda with information about [Oriana's|megametracker://person?id=O2.Oriana] transfer.

persons.name: Lia'Vael nar Ulnay
persons.description: After accidentally running into a suspicious volus in Zakera Ward, Lia'Vael finds herself accused of theft and C-Sec is threatening to arrest her.

persons.name: Maelon Heplorn
persons.description: Mordin's former protege, Maelon assisted in the original work on the Genophage by the salraian Special Tasks Group. He came to regret his actions, believing that the other races would have been forced to become more vigilant in the face of an expanding krogan population, thereby better preparing them for Saren and the Reaper invasion. Regardless, his experiments to cure the Genophage were reckless and inhumane.
sideEffects: If Maelon survives Game 2, he opens a clinic on Omega (like Mordin did), but is forced to leave it when Clan Weyrloc puts a price on his head. If the genophage is cured, he sends a message thanking you and says he hopes to return to the clinic now, and hopes one day to meet the survivors of his experiments and ask their forgiveness.

persons.name: Marab
persons.description: The shopkeeper/customer service at Saronis Applications in Zakera Ward, Marab will offer Shepard a discount in exchange for an endorsement.

persons.name: Marsh
persons.description: Shopkeeper of the Omega Market.

persons.name: Mouse
persons.description: A former Citadel "Duct Rat," Mouse once provided [megametracker://person?id=S2.Thane] with information in exchange for sweets. He has grown into a petty criminal, hawking illegal Shepard VIs. [megametracker://person?id=O2.Kolyat] exploits this prior relationship to convince Mouse to find Kolyat a gig as an assassin.

persons.name: Narom
persons.description: Narom set up a base on Sanctum and used it to send false distress signals to passing merchant freighters in order to capture them and steal their goods. He reports to [megametracker://id?=E2.Vido].

persons.name: Nef
persons.description: A young resident of Omega, Nef unfortunately fell prey to the wiles of [megametracker://person?id=E2.Morinth] and was murdered. Her mother has kept all her things and shares them with Shepard and Samara in the hopes of bringing Nef's killer to justice.

persons.name: Niket
persons.description: Niket helped [Miranda|megametracker://person?id=S2.Miranda] escape her father when she was a teenager, but he disagreed with her decision to rescue her sister [Oriana|megametracker://person?id=O2.Oriana] as a child. He thought Oriana should be able to make that decision herself, and he informs Dr. Lawson and arranges for Oriana's return.

persons.name: Niftu Cal
persons.description: An unfortunate member of [Pitne For's|megametracker://person?id=O2.PitneFor] trading group, Niftu was taken by the Eclipse and pumped full of red sand, granting him (meager) biotic powers.
sideEffects: Mark Meer, aka BroShep, voices Niftu Cal also.
Loot Crate's Mass Effect box included a stuffed volus toy, to which I added my own voicebox to make it cry "I am a biotic GOD!" when squeezed. [Vimeo video|https://vimeo.com/152031926]

persons.name: Ogrinn
persons.description: Depending on Shepard's response to being poisoned by [megametracker://person?id=O2.Forvan], Ogrinn may shoot and kill Forvan when the latter pulls a gun on Shepard.

persons.name: Okeer
persons.description: The Blue Suns Commander [megametracker://person?id=E2.Jedore] funded Okeer to build her an army of Krogans, but his true goal is to build the perfect cloned krogan. He willingly sacrifices the thousands of failed krogan children he creates for the sake of the one tank he thinks is perfect. In the end, Jedore realizes he betrayed her and in retribution poisons the lab, to kill his krogan "son."

persons.name: Oriana Lawson
persons.description: [Miranda's|megametracker://person?id=S2.Miranda] sister, a genetically identical copied created by their wealthy and ruthless father. Miranda rescued her as a child and has been keeping her location secret from their father.

3.description: [Miranda's|megametracker://person?id=S2.Miranda] sister, a genetically identical copied created by their wealthy and ruthless father. After Miranda rescued her as a child and kept her location secret from their father for years, he captures her with the help of Cerberus, at his lab on Horizon, masquerading as the refuge Sanctuary.

persons.name: Patriarch
persons.description: A former mentor of Aria, Patriarch used to run Omega. After defeating him in a man-to-man fight, Aria kept him around as a symbol of her power. She called him the "Patriarch," in a mocking play on the asari word "matriarch," but nonetheless she carries a deep affection for him.

persons.name: Pitne For
persons.description: Pitne For's business partner, Dakni Kur, was murdered by the Eclipse. Fearing for his life, Pitne wants to leave Illium, but is detained pending the investigation. He claims all his business dealings are legal and insists he has no idea why the Eclipse has targetted him.

persons.name: Prazza
persons.description: Despite Tali's order to work with Shepard, Prazza takes his team ahead, trying to find Veetor before Shepard does. He and most of his team end up killed by an YMIR Mech.

persons.name: Quentius
persons.description: If Shepard fails to save the Destiny Ascension, he replaces the deceased [megametracker://person?id=O1.Sparatus].

persons.name: Rael'Zorah
persons.description:
Rael'Zorah is Tali's father and a member of the quarian Admiralty Board. At the conclusion of [megametracker://mission?id=A2.D.Tali], he sends Shepard a message acknowledging Tali's assignment to the Normandy, which concludes with a somewhat threatening warning that no harm had better come to her. 

He is involved in geth research for the Fleet, looking for technology to create weapons against the geth. His final fate (and unethical and dangerous research) are revealed during [megametracker://mission?id=A2.L.Tali].

persons.name: Ratch
persons.description: Ratch runs one of the shops in the Urdnot camp on Tuchanka, Ratch's Wares. He is generally friendlier than the other krogan, explaining that alien visitors have more credits and he needs their business.
sideEffects: An entertaining ANN news story about the lovable varren, Grimrender, features Ratch: [https://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Alliance_News_Network/Profiles_in_Courage#Silversun_Strip].

persons.name: Chief Roe
persons.description: Head of security for Donovan Hock, she prefers to keep her distance from the extravagant party at his mansion and instead monitors the events remotely.

persons.name: Salkie
persons.description: Heading logistics in the attack on Archangel, Salkie is waiting for recruits by the shuttles. If you did not dissuade [megametracker://person?id=O2.Whitson] from signing up, he will arrive with your group and Salkie will direct him back to the rest of the gathering mercs before debriefing your team.

persons.name: Sekat
persons.description: One of Liara's information sources, Sekat helps her identify the Shadow Broker's base of operations. Unfortunately, he is killed before Shepard reaches the Dracon Trade Center.

persons.name: Shaman
persons.description: The Shaman respects [megametracker://person?id=S1.Wrex]'s progressive ideas and dislikes the more traditional [masseffecttarcker://person?id=E2.Uvenk]. He supports [Grunt's|megametracker://person?id=S2.Grunt] admittance to the Rite of Passage. He is not pleased by a paragon Shepard, but praises an aggressive Shepard.

persons.name: Joram Talid
persons.description: An anti-human politician, Talid shakes down human businesses for money on the Citadel and is all-around a terrible person. He is the target of an assassination attempt which Shepard must foil to protect [Thane's|megametracker://person?id=S2.Thane] son, Kolyat.
sideEffects: When Talid uses the line what have humans have done for you, one salarian responds with "I like their food," which recalls the comedy *Life of Brian*, when the Jewish resistance group goes a similar route in complaining/not complaining about the occupying Romans.

persons.name: Ronald Taylor
persons.description: First Officer on the Hugo Gernsback, Ronald Taylor became captain when the prior captain was killed during the crash on [megametracker://map?id=G.Ter.Ros.Alp.2175Aeia].

persons.name: Rukar
persons.description: Rukar can be found in Zakera Ward arguing with his companion, [masseffectracker://person?id=O2.Kargesh], over whether there are fish in the Presidium lakes. He is skeptical of the idea.

persons.name: Lantar Sidonis
persons.description: Sidonis is an old member of Garrus' squad on Omega who betrayed his team to the Blue Suns, luring Garrus away with a false lead while the rest of the squad was murdered.

persons.name: Etarn Tiron
persons.description: Shopkeeper at Rodam Expeditions in Zakera Ward, he is very displeased if Shepard chose to let the Citadel Council die in Game 1. He can be persuaded to give a discount either way.
sideEffects: If Shepard saved the Council and acquires the store discount, Tiron comments that he would name his first-born after Shepard if asked to.

persons.name: Veetor'Nara
persons.description: Agoraphobic with a history of mental instability, Veetor elected to complete his pilgrimage at the remote human colony of Freedom's Progress. After the Collector attack there, he is the only surviving eye witness. Due to his fragility, Tali wants to bring him back to the Migrant Fleet for recovery, but Cerberus wants Shepard to bring him back to their people for interrogation.
sideEffects: If you let Cerberus take Veetor, he will not testify on Tali's behalf during [megametracker://mission?id=A2.L.Tali], which is key to preventing one of the most devastating events of Game 3.

persons.name: Jonn Whitson
persons.description: Jonn is young and inexperienced, but tries to sign on for the attack on Archangel just after you do in Afterlife. If you do not dissuade him, he will show up at the base around the time you do and is Archangel's first kill in the attack.

persons.name: Wilson
persons.description: While Shepard is escaping the Lazarus research facility, he briefly allies with Wilson until the doctor claims Miranda is the traitor who sabotaged the facility, at which point Miranda kills him.

persons.name: Urdnot Wreav
persons.description:
Wreav is violent, ruthless, racist, sexist, and perpetually looking for opportunities to go to war.

 If Wrex died on Virmire in Game 1, Wreav replaces Wrex's role as leader of Clan Urdnot in the following games. If Wrex survived to Game 3, Shepard will encounter Wreav during [megametracker://mission?id=M3.1.Tuchanka], leading a combative group of krogan furious at Mordin's presence. Wreave's tomkah is later sunk by [megametracker://person?id=O3.Kalros], leading Wrex to comment: "He was a pain in the ass, anyway."
